resources.string: Hey, look at me, I\'m the first fragment
(1) Type in a name and click on the button.
(2) Two different ways to bind an onClick event.
Type in an URL to create an intent that opens the web page.
This exercise connects to the internet and converts an image to the displayed bitmap.
(1) Exercise on checkboxes, radio buttons, and spinners. Submit button brings up a toast component.
(2) Exercise on ProgressBar and TimePicker. Clicking on the button starts a new async thread that count downs to 5 seconds.
Persist small key-value data using SharedPreferences. Save some data here and revisit to see that data are persisted.
A content provider component supplies data from one application to others on request. This exercise fetches and displays a list of contacts from your phone.

A broadcast receiver is an Android component which allows you to register for system or application events. They simply respond to broadcast messages from other applications or from the system itself.
This exercise registers the AIRPLANE_MODE intent and displays a toast upon an event change. To see it in action, toggle your phone\'s airplane mode on this view.
This exercises uses the SmsManager API. Fill out a phone number to text and a message to send.
Android drag/drop framework allows users to move data from one View to another View in the current layout. Exercise: Drag and drop Yes/No to the circle.
A notification is a message you display to the user as an icon in the notification area.
For this exercise, click on the button to see the notification. Upon clicking on the notification, you\'ll be redirect to another exercise.
Create, edit, or delete contacts from the menu action bar.
